description: '''Chillstep''' is a subgenre of [[dubstep]] with a softer, melodic, and atmospheric sound, combined with the heavy bass and rhythms of traditional dubstep. It combines elements of [[ambient music]], [[Chill-out music|chillout]], and [[Downtempo music|downtempo]] electronic styles, mostly featuring ethereal vocals and relaxed tempos, typically around 120â€“140 beats per minute. Chillstep emerged in the late 2000s, primarily in the United Kingdom, as producers sought to create a more soothing alternative to the aggressive, heavy sound of mainstream dubstep.
